file_content.text: Once we finish our analysis, we'll find a reliable defense for this new technology. You've done the Empire a great service.
The Esh-kha were ransacking the vault, but I dealt with them. Here are your samples.
I stopped the Esh-kha.
These are even more advanced than I thought.
I don't believe it--Nattis was right. I owe you my thanks for getting involved.
An Esh-kha force armed with these would've been disastrous. Some sort of plasma recharger... Belsavis could've fallen completely.
You were right this time, but don't let it go to your head.
Just don't get cocky, Nattis.
Wise words, of course.
You should be proud of standing by your convictions, Nattis.
Yes--you stopped a disaster.
You're kind to say so, but I only did my job.
Your narrow vision nearly cost the Empire its foothold. You're lucky to outlive this mistake.
Hayg, you should be hanged.
Thank you for your mercy. I'll respect Specialist Nattis's expertise in the future, I promise.
Well... I'm just glad things worked out in the end.
I'll take the samples for analysis. Understanding how to defend against this technology is critical.
Don't forget to bring back samples of the weaponry once you've dealt with the Esh-kha.
The Reclamation Service is mandated to study all dangerous alien technology.
Military decisions are my call!
My lord--forgive my tone. Our science officer here thinks he understands troop deployments better than me.
Agent--talk some sense into our science officer here, would you? He thinks he understands troop deployments better than me.
Hunter. The lone-wolf lifestyle must be nice... no dimwit subordinates. Our science officer here thinks he knows troop deployments better than me.
Sorry about the tone. Our science officer here thinks he understands troop deployments better than me.
I'm simply concerned. We engaged the Esh-kha yesterday. Two were carrying strange blasters--ancient but highly advanced. What's scary is it felt like a test.
You think they were evaluating the weapons?
What kind of test?
Against Imperial capabilities, yes. They slaughtered several men then just disengaged. These blasters were clearly alien.
Identify yourself.
Oh, uh... Specialist Nattis, Reclamation Service. My expertise is alien cultures, and these blasters were clearly alien.
You're dangerously close to insubordination.
You dare speak out of turn?
Insubordination is a dangerous game. Perhaps even deadly.
You dare speak out of turn?
I didn't think Imperial types took kindly to insubordination.
Challenging your boss, huh?
Insubordination in a combat zone can land you in a shallow grave.
You dare question a superior?
I have no choice. I study alien cultures for the Reclamation Service, and these weapons are clearly a threat to Imperial forces.
Their bolts boil through armor. The medics say the tissue damage is horrific.
I told Nattis--the Republic's our priority, and we're already shorthanded. We just--please excuse me. I have a team reporting in.
My lord, I understand his perspective. But if the Esh-kha acquire enough of these weapons, they'll become the biggest threat to Imperial forces on Belsavis.
He's ignoring this fact: Once they've acquired enough of these weapons, the Esh-kha will crush us, Republic or no Republic.
You seem confident they can get their hands on additional weapons.
How would they get more?
Intelligence says the Esh-kha recently cracked an ancient storage vault. I translated the manifest fragments.
This isn't my business.
Because Hayg won't get involved. The Esh-kha recently cracked an ancient storage vault. I translated the manifest fragments.
I think you're blowing this out of proportion.
Sounds like an exaggeration.
I'm not. The Esh-kha recently cracked an ancient storage vault. I translated the manifest fragments.
The vault holds large numbers of weapons confiscated by an ancient alien tribunal. Enough to arm the entire Esh-kha population.
We need to stop them and study this technology before we face it again.
I shall slaughter these fools and give you your chance for study.
I'll do it.
Once I've dispatched these Esh-kha, you will have ample opportunity for study.
I'll do it.
I can solve your Esh-kha problem. For a price, of course.
I'll do it.
Oh, I see. I think I can convince the Reclamation Service to scrape something together.
I'll neutralize the Esh-kha threat and give you your chance for research.
I'll do it.
Fine, but let's make it quick.
Of course. I understand.
Be careful of the Esh-kha guarding the vault. They've already figured out those weapons--I doubt we can even find the trigger.
But anything you can bring back... we'll see what we can do.
Sorry--I'm with Hayg on this one.
I can't help. [Refuse quest]
That's... disappointing. I hope I'll find someone willing to do something.
I'm afraid I can't talk. I'm waiting for an intelligence report.
